text: General elections were held in Niue on 30 May 2020.Niue elections scheduled for next month Radio New Zealand, 16 April 2020 ==Electoral system== The 20 members of the Assembly are elected by two methods; 14 are elected from single-member consistencies and six are elected from a single nationwide constituency.Niue IFES Both types of seat use first-past-the-post voting. ==Campaign== A total of 54 candidates contested the elections, of which 26 contested the six common roll seats. Three candidates – Mona Ainuu in Tuapa, Enetama Lipitoa in Namukulu and Talaititama Talaiti in Vaiea – were elected unopposed.Niue Election 2020 – Prelim List Tala Niue, 14 May 2020 One of the candidates was former New Zealand MP and mayor of Wellington Mark Blumsky. ==Results== The Premier Toke Talagi, in office for the previous twelve years, lost his seat, finishing tenth in the six-seat common roll constituency.Premier of Niue loses seat in election Radio New Zealand, 1 June 2020 Five of the elected members were new to the Assembly. After a draw in Mutalau, the result was decided by a coin toss. The results of the election reduced the number of women in the Assembly dropped from 5 to 3, with only one women in cabinet, Mona Ainuu. In a secret ballot, the Assembly elected Dalton Tagelagi as Premier in a 13-7 vote against O'Love Jacobsen, and Hima Douglas was elected Speaker on the third ballot. The new Cabinet was announced on June 11. ===Common roll results=== {| class=wikitable style="text-align:right ! Candidate ! Votes ! % !
